item.title: SRU Steels Q3 FY26: Revenue Collapse Signals Deep Operational Distress
item.description: SRU Steels Limited reported a loss of ₹0.04 crores in Q3 FY26, marking a sharp reversal from profitability in the previous quarter, as revenue collapsed 64.24% sequentially to just ₹1.18 crores. The micro-cap steel trading company, with a market capitalisation of ₹21.00 crores, witnessed its stock trading at ₹3.40 on February 20, 2026, down 61.19% over the past year and significantly underperforming the broader market. Time: Feb 21 2026 10:15 PM IST

item.title: Kirloskar Electric Declines 8.30%: Valuation Reset and Bearish Momentum Shape Week
item.description: Kirloskar Electric Company Ltd experienced a challenging week, with its stock price declining by 8.30% from Rs.98.90 to Rs.90.69, sharply underperforming the Sensex which rose modestly by 0.39%. The week was marked by a significant valuation recalibration and a shift towards bearish technical momentum, reflecting growing investor caution amid sector headwinds and mixed market signals. Time: Feb 21 2026 05:16 PM IST

item.title: Hindustan Petroleum Falls 4.25%: 2 Key Factors Driving the Weekly Decline
item.description: Hindustan Petroleum Corporation Ltd. (HPCL) closed the week ending 20 Feb 2026 at Rs.431.15, down 4.25% from the previous Friday’s close of Rs.450.30. This decline contrasted with the Sensex’s modest 0.39% gain over the same period, highlighting HPCL’s underperformance amid sector-specific pressures and heightened market volatility. The week was marked by a sharp intraday low on 19 Feb and a surge in derivatives open interest on 20 Feb, signalling shifting investor sentiment and increased trading activity. Time: Feb 21 2026 05:15 PM IST

item.title: IB Infotech Enterprises Ltd Surges 27.61%: 6 Key Factors Driving the Rally
item.description: IB Infotech Enterprises Ltd delivered a remarkable weekly performance from 16 to 20 February 2026, surging 27.61% from Rs.395.00 to Rs.504.05, vastly outperforming the Sensex’s modest 0.39% gain. The stock consistently hit new 52-week and all-time highs throughout the week, reflecting strong momentum and sustained investor interest despite a cautious Mojo Grade of Sell. This review analyses the key events and price movements that shaped the stock’s exceptional week. Time: Feb 21 2026 05:15 PM IST

item.title: Hexaware Technologies Falls 7.03%: 4 Key Factors Behind the Weekly Decline
item.description: Hexaware Technologies Ltd experienced a challenging week from 16 to 20 February 2026, with its share price declining by 7.03% to close at Rs.521.50, significantly underperforming the Sensex which gained 0.39% over the same period. The week was marked by a downgrade to a 'Sell' rating, valuation concerns, technical weakness, and a fresh 52-week low, all contributing to heightened investor caution amid mixed financial signals. Time: Feb 21 2026 05:15 PM IST

item.title: Torrent Pharmaceuticals Gains 4.02%: 7 Key Factors Driving the Week’s Momentum
item.description: Torrent Pharmaceuticals Ltd. delivered a solid weekly gain of 4.02%, closing at Rs.4,237.80 on 20 February 2026, outperforming the Sensex’s modest 0.39% rise. The week was marked by multiple new 52-week and all-time highs, robust institutional interest, and strong derivatives activity, underscoring sustained bullish momentum despite some intraweek volatility. Time: Feb 21 2026 05:15 PM IST

item.title: Aurionpro Solutions Ltd Gains 1.39%: 2 Key Factors Driving This Week’s Momentum
item.description: Aurionpro Solutions Ltd recorded a modest weekly gain of 1.39%, closing at Rs.944.90 on 20 February 2026, outperforming the Sensex’s 0.39% rise over the same period. The week was marked by a significant intraday surge on 18 February, followed by a technical momentum shift amid mixed market signals, reflecting a complex trading environment for the stock. Time: Feb 21 2026 05:15 PM IST

item.title: Spice Islands Industries Ltd Falls 9.32%: Valuation Upgrade Amidst Weekly Decline
item.description: Spice Islands Industries Ltd experienced a challenging week on the bourses, with its share price declining by 9.32% from ₹302.65 on 13 February 2026 to ₹274.45 on 20 February 2026. This underperformance contrasted sharply with the Sensex, which rose modestly by 0.39% over the same period. Despite the stock’s recent upgrade to a Hold rating by MarketsMOJO, reflecting improved valuation and financial metrics, the week’s trading reflected investor caution amid mixed fundamental signals and persistent valuation premiums. Time: Feb 21 2026 05:15 PM IST

item.title: Pritish Nandy Communications Ltd Falls 6.41%: 2 Key Factors Driving the Weekly Decline
item.description: Pritish Nandy Communications Ltd experienced a challenging week, with its stock price declining 6.41% from ₹27.13 to ₹25.39, underperforming the Sensex which gained 0.39% over the same period. The week was marked by a significant valuation shift and a downgrade to a strong sell rating amid mixed financial and technical signals, reflecting investor caution despite some operational improvements. Time: Feb 21 2026 05:15 PM IST

item.title: Baba Arts Ltd Gains 12.60%: 6 Key Factors Driving the Surge
item.description: Baba Arts Ltd delivered a robust weekly performance, gaining 12.60% from Rs.10.87 to Rs.12.24 between 16 and 20 February 2026, significantly outperforming the Sensex’s modest 0.39% rise over the same period. The stock’s rally was marked by multiple new 52-week highs, a notable technical breakout with a Golden Cross formation, and an upgrade in its Mojo Grade from ‘Strong Sell’ to ‘Sell’. Despite a slight pullback on the final trading day, Baba Arts Ltd demonstrated strong momentum and resilience amid mixed market conditions. Time: Feb 21 2026 05:15 PM IST

item.title: Goodluck India Ltd Gains 11.50%: 3 Key Factors Driving the Week’s Momentum
item.description: Goodluck India Ltd delivered a strong weekly performance, rising 11.50% from Rs.1,085.75 to Rs.1,210.65 between 16 and 20 February 2026, significantly outperforming the Sensex’s modest 0.39% gain over the same period. The stock’s momentum was driven by a series of positive technical developments, an upgrade in investment rating, and robust relative returns amid a mixed market backdrop. Time: Feb 21 2026 05:14 PM IST

item.title: Sanjivani Paranteral Ltd Falls 6.96%: Valuation Shifts and Rating Upgrade Shape the Week
item.description: Sanjivani Paranteral Ltd experienced a challenging week on the BSE, closing at Rs.195.85 on 20 Feb 2026, down 6.96% from the previous Friday’s close of Rs.210.50. This decline contrasted with the Sensex’s modest gain of 0.39% over the same period, highlighting the stock’s underperformance amid mixed financial and valuation developments. Key events during the week included an upgrade to a 'Hold' rating by MarketsMOJO and a notable shift in valuation metrics, both influencing investor sentiment and price action. Time: Feb 21 2026 05:14 PM IST
